embeds.title: Heroic Bravado
embeds.description:
Rare Skill / 1 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

**Ethereal**.
Gain 1 **Rugged** :p_rugged:.
Increase the cost of this card by 2 (1) this combat.

messages.content: nice beta art lol
Odd effect, im not sure how to weigh this up against defects <Buffer>

embeds.title: Buffer
embeds.description:
Keyword / Downfall

Prevent the next time you would lose HP.

messages.content: <Rugged>

embeds.title: Rugged
embeds.description:
Keyword / Downfall

Reduces next instance of attack damage taken to 2.

messages.content: it is repeatable though
and far better in the heart fight
Its just kinda worse though isnt it
Like yeah upgraded its 2 over 2 uses, but you do actually take chip damage
and that's why <reprieve> is a thing

embeds.title: Reprieve
embeds.description:
Rare Skill / 2 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

**Ethereal**.
Heal 12 (15) HP.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: <Self Repair>

embeds.title: Self Repair
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :blue_energy: / The Defect / Slay the Spire

At the end of combat, heal 7 (10) HP.

messages.content: Which is also better
self repair is later
reprieve is now
Yeah and the gap [E]->HP is massive
6(7.5) vs 7(10), with self repair being notably much easier to play
Oh and it has synergy with <Heatsinks> and <Storm> too

embeds.title: Heatsinks
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :blue_energy: / The Defect / Slay the Spire

Whenever you play a Power card, draw 1 (2) card (cards).

embeds.title: Storm
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :blue_energy: / The Defect / Slay the Spire

 (**Innate**.)
Whenever you play a Power card, Channel 1 Lightning.

messages.content: pretty great card. Rugged is almost as good as buffer and being able to access its effect for just one energy is pretty powerful and worthy of a rare card. The cost of heroic bravado increases as the fight goes on, but its still reasonable to pay 2 energys to play this and it will exhaust itself when you cannot play it anymore. You also have both cheat and etheral form to reduce this card's cost. Notability strong with snecko eye just like desperado as its downside is basically negated with its cost being randomized each turn. really the only problem this card has is being ineffective ageist the heart's multi hit attack; although you can still use it to block the hearts big attack.
You do also have lone wolf to make it 0 cost for a turn
ah yes, the argument of "using these 2 rare cards together"
<gestalt>
I would agree though that rugged is almost as good as buffer

embeds.title: Gestalt
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 2 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Gain 2 **Rugged** :p_rugged:.
Gain 2 (1) **Vulnerable** :p_vulnerable:.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: I'd rather just have gestalt tbh
Because once you can't play bravado it is technically a dead draw still, and I'd rather have gestalt give the 2 rugged immediately
Gestalt does seem better in most of the cases that you would want rugged
Also it is uncommon so easier to get
not like, always
but most
plus hermit has high burst damage so the amount of times you get to fully use bravado is pretty limited
question: how often do you guys play bravado at 3 cost (in situations where it is drawn at 3)
honestly I think bravado is pretty bad, I'd rather it just exhaust after the first play. Upgrade is kinda bad, because 2 cost for 1 rugged usually isn't worth it anyway.
Plus by your second deck cycle a lot of things should already be dead
well I meant in terms of rugged in general
I guess you have to often think of bravado as "1 cost, gain 1 rugged. Put a dazed into your discard pile. Exhaust"
there is stuff like lone wolf and cheat, but tbh that's putting in a lot of effort for not a lot of results.
Considering there is <desperado> which acts similarly but scales better

embeds.title: Desperado
embeds.description:
Uncommon Attack / 1 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Deal 10 (12) damage.
Double this card's damage this combat. It costs 1 more.

messages.content: ~~quadratically~~
there is better cost increasing cards, there is better rugged cards, I don't think bravado is that good.
idk math so I just said better 🤷‍♂️

This card has a lot of variance attached to it, in a way that gestalt does not. If you are in an AOE fight, or the enemy is multi-attacking, you have to use this or lose it due to the ethereal, so you can't combine it with runic pyramid or coalescence to wait for the right moment to play it (extremely relevant against the heart, time eater, awakened one, shield and spear, etc.) Sometimes you will get lucky and either just happen to draw it one the right turn, or draw it on a turn where you can protect the rugged to be used later on a more appropriate turn. Rugged is extremely vulnerable to getting wasted against multi hit attacks, and this card kind of doubles down on that because of ethereal. I find that fairly often, you draw this on the wrong turn and it performs well below expectations.

Worth noting that in some ways rugged can be better than a buffer stack, since it only looks at attack damage from enemies. That means that beat of death, burn, decay, pain, thorns from spikers, and other small sources of non-attack damage/loss of life won't use up rugged charges (anyone who's drawn buffer alongside no block against the heart knows this pain). Rugged is very powerful against certain specific attacks in the spire, but gestalt is by far the better card because it gives you better frontloaded mitigation, it's not a dead draw late in a fight, it has synergy with determination/virtue, and it can be held for the right moment. I would usually take a heroic bravado over skipping, but it's a pretty disappointing rare to take from a boss reward, and I would almost never buy it at a shop. It is a pretty decent reward from a neow bonus, since it does well in act 1 against nob and lagavulin. 

Gets better if you can find the 4th energy, which makes it easier to block on the same turn and protect the rugged stack for later. The upgrade is almost useless, not many fights last long enough to redraw this, and the impact of  it costing 1 less energy on turn 8 is pretty dubious.

I think it probably deserves at least a small buff. I really don't think it needs to have ethereal, I understand ethereal gets it out of the way once it's too expensive, but it does far more harm than good when you consider the runic pyramid/coalescence interaction. I would rather see something like "Gain 1 rugged. Exhaust." and have the upgrade either reduce the cost to 0, or the rugged to 2. It's so weird to have the rare be so much worse than the uncommon version of this effect in <gestalt>

embeds.title: Gestalt
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 2 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Gain 2 **Rugged** :p_rugged:.
Gain 2 (1) **Vulnerable** :p_vulnerable:.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: Alex has contemplated the "gain 1 rugged. exhaust." idea
might be ok if you also got more rugged per cost, as is i'd probably pick almost any other hermit rare over this in every scenario
probably only stuff like <high noon> in non-strike deck or <fatal desire> in non-curse deck with no adapt would be worse options and make me pick this

embeds.title: High Noon
embeds.description:
Rare Power / 2 (1) :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Whenever you play a Strike or Defend, draw a card.

embeds.title: Fatal Desire
embeds.description:
Rare Power / 1 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

 (**Innate**.)
At the start of your turn, draw 2 cards and add an Injury to your hand.

messages.content: Fatal Desire in a non-curse deck without Adapt is still not too bad
it's like a frontloaded machine Learning
oh actually final canter in a non curse deck is probably the worst
I am an advocate for increase cost upgrades
In this case it might actually work
`Heroic Bravado [Rare] [Skill] [Hermit] [1(2)e]: Gain 1(2) Rugged. Exhaust.`
Just a straightforward effect, upgrade raises density
I like the price increasing, would 1(0) cost gain 1 rugged increase cost by 1 rest of combat be too strong?
so it currently upgraded would be what the new one would be unupgraded, and the new one's upgrade makes it even cheaper.
Would that be too strong?
Well defect <type=card buffer> is doing 2 stronger charges at this cost point

embeds.title: Buffer
embeds.description:
Rare Power / 2 :blue_energy: / The Defect / Slay the Spire

Prevent the next time (2)  (times) you would lose HP.

messages.content: Albeit with a relatively atrocious unupgraded form
So i would expect `Bravado` to provide a stronger effect if it were priced the same
The issue with "just match cost over uses" is that you arnt really matching the cost
1(0) cost results in a cost of 0, 1, 2 for **3** rugged which seems great at first
but this also costs **3d**
Defects buffer meanwhile always costs **2e**, **1d**
Either method would be applicible, but the draw cost should be taken into account
The current form is vastly inferior, so much so i would argue it would better serve as an uncommon
Not only does it currently take 3 energy for two lesser charges, you also spend an additional card draw on it
we shouldn't make a good card uncommon just because a broken card (gestalt) is better then it and does a similar thing
I think heroic bravado is fine on its own, its not taken every time but still provides consistent value when it is

besides gestalt and heroic bravado are good paired together, making them both uncommons gives hermit easy access to a powerful defensive buff thats only close to other buffs that are quite rare on the other 4 characters (silent has 1 intangibility rare card, defect has 1 buffer rare card and watcher has 1 rare skip a turn card; ironclad doesn't have one at all)
ironclad has <barricade>

embeds.title: Barricade
embeds.description:
Rare Power / 3 (2) :red_energy: / The Ironclad / Slay the Spire

**Block** :p_block: is not removed at the start of your turn.

messages.content: not quite the same thing but considering all of the other defense tools in Ironclad's pocket it does not need to be

I don't think barricade really counts, its a power that lasts an entire fight unlike those other 4 cards which give a 1 time use get out of jail free card from taking damage; by ether preventing it or reducing it to negligible ammounts
IC's get out of jail free is Impervious
didn't someone give examples of it specifically not being consistent though?
thats a better comparison sure, but its still operating like a normal card (if impervious counts then so would panic button)
no ethereal card is live every time its drawn, but this card is still more consistent then the average ethereal card because you can store the buff for later
I find that even if my heroic bravado only gets to be played one time its still very helpful that one time its used
i think it used to be exactly that but Alex nerfed it
I know the unupgraded was for a fact
Huh. I know gestalt has been changed time and time again, so maybe it was just outshining the opposition?
